message.content:
cs.CL, cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CV 

The paper deals with document classification, which is a common problem in natural language processing (NLP). The use of deep learning architectures for this task suggests that the paper may belong to the sub-category of Computational Linguistics (cs.CL). Additionally, the paper deals with information retrieval (IR) and machine learning (ML) techniques, which are also relevant to the sub-categories of Information Retrieval (cs.IR) and Machine Learning (cs.LG). The use of deep learning architectures also suggests that the paper may belong to the sub-category of Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI). Finally, the paper may also be relevant to the sub-category of Computer Vision (cs.CV), as some of the deep learning architectures used in the paper may be relevant to image classification tasks.
